intro: Lannea djalonica, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and smooth, pale bark. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange-red berries that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and hard timber, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
